definitions: To be considered or treated as unimportant, irrelevant, or unworthy of serious consideration.
To be rejected or disregarded, often unfairly, by categorizing it in a particular way.
examples: Her concerns were dismissed as mere paranoia.
The new theory was dismissed as unscientific by the established experts.
His early work was dismissed as amateurish.
The evidence was dismissed as circumstantial.
